patient_info: Proteinuria,Xerostomia,Large for gestational age,Fever,Hypercholesterolemia,Decreased body weight,Macroscopic hematuria
golden_diagnosis: Alport syndrome, X-linked,Alport syndrome 2, autosomal recessive,Alport syndrome 3, autosomal dominant,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome,Alport 综合征/Alport syndrome/Alport syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Fanconi Syndrome - X-linked recessive disorder characterized by impaired renal tubular function, proteinuria, and microscopic hematuria.
2. Glomerulonephritis - Inflammation of the glomeruli, leading to proteinuria, hematuria, and edema. It can be due to various causes, including SLE, vasculitis, or autoimmune disease.
3. Diabetic Nephropathy - A complication of diabetes that involves kidney damage, proteinuria, and hypertension.
4. Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome - A group of rare diseases characterized by hemolytic anemia, thrombotic microangiopathy, and renal failure.
5. Goodpasture's Disease - An autoimmune disorder causing inflammation and damage to the glomeruli and vasculature in the lungs and kidneys.
6. Lennox-Braun Syndrome - An X-linked dominant disorder characterized by proteinuria, hematuria, and glomerular hypertrophy.
7. Membranoproliferative Glomerulonephritis - A group of diseases characterized by proliferation of epithelial cells on the inner surface of the glomeruli, leading to proteinuria and hematuria.
8. Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) - A hormonal disorder that can cause proteinuria, obesity, and irregular menstruation.
9. Renal Vasculitis - Inflammation of the blood vessels in the kidneys, leading to proteinuria and hematuria.
10. Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH) Receptor Antibodies - A condition where the immune system produces antibodies that stimulate the thyroid gland, leading to hyperthyroidism and proteinuria.
